request.name: get_system_pip
request.description: This request is deprecated. If you want to create a new request, you can reuse this one. FYI, in that case, you also need to modify get_system_pip method in luna-surfacemanager as well.

request.name: get_shell_surface

description.summary: create a shell surface from a surface

request.description: Creates an webos shell surface for an existing surface.

interface.name: wl_webos_shell_surface

description.summary: create a webos shell surface from a surface

interface.description: This allows the client to associate an normal surface with a shell surface. The shell surface provides webos specific functionality to surfaces

request.name: set_location_hint
request.description: The location hint is a guideline to the compositor where to place the surface. The compositor will do its best to place it there, however this is not guaranteed. Currently The location hint is only applied to _WEBOS_WINDOW_TYPE_POPUP and _WEBOS_WINDOW_TYPE_SYSTEM_UI surfaces.

enum.name: location_hint
enum.description: Using this mask the surface can be positioned onto different locations on screen. By not using absolute coordinates we can create greater flexibility in the compositor and the clients.

enum.name: state
enum.description:
The state provides info to the client on how the compositor has placed the surface.
The default state will indicate to the client that it is windowed. The "position_changed" event will tell the position in screen coordinates when the surface is in this state.

request.name: set_state
request.description: The client requests its surface state to the compositor.

request.name: set_property
request.description: The client sets the surface property to the compositor. The property is given by a string pair (name, value).

enum.name: webos_key

description.summary: The key that the surface handels

enum.description: The client uses wl_webos_shell_surface.set_key_mask to notify server that it will handle specific keys only.

request.name: set_key_mask

description.summary: sets the key mask for this surface

request.description:
A value of '1' in the mask indicates that the respective key event (both press and release) will be delivered to the client. Bitwise XOR operation against the default mask value and a supported individual values will result in that key not being delivered to the client. Notice that the default value omits certain keys.
The compositor is free to ignore certain keys even if set to '1' depending on the overall system UI behaviour, most commonly this will mean the HOME key.
NOTE: This protocol will eventually replace the string property based key filtering

event.name: state_changed
event.description: The compositor or the user has taken action that has resulted in this surface to change state.

event.name: position_changed

description.summary: The surface position on screen changed

event.description: This event will only be sent the surfaces that are in their default state. It will be not sent for fullscreen surfaces nor for surfaces that are minimized.

event.name: close
event.description: The close event is sent when the compositor requests closing of a window, e.g. through some gesture or other interaction, without explicitly quitting or killing the client.

event.name: exposed
event.description: The array contains non-overlapping rectangles that define areas that are visible in this surface. The array elements are a series of ints arranged as follows x,y,w,h,x,y,w,h,-1. The values will not contain negative numbers and the -1 is treated as a terminating marker.

event.name: state_about_to_change

description.summary: The surface state is about to change

event.description: Be sure that the actual state should not be changed with this. Client can only prepare that state will be changed.
